lead_paragraph: PAOLELLA--Edward C.,74 years old and a retired professor at Brooklyn College who taught for more than 30 years, passed away on February 11, 2016 after battling Leukemia. Professor Paolella was known as a witty, brilliant and provocative teacher. He was a bibliophile who donated more than 10,000 volumes to Brooklyn College. Edward was predeceased by his father Nicholas Paolella, his mother Dorothy Edlavitch-Paolella, and his sister Rhoda Dimino. Edward is survived by his brother Lawrence Paolella and his sister-in-law Margaret Ryan of Walla Walla, WA, his nieces Gillian Paolella, and his great-niece Ravenna, niece Jonna Paolella and her husband David Kliphon, nephews, many cousins, relatives and dedicated lifelong friends. Memorial Services will be held on April 9, 2016 at a venue to be determined. For information, email rmontelione@aol.com. In lieu of flowers, please donate to Services & Advocacy for GLBT Elders (SAGE), 305 Seventh Ave, 15th Floor, New York, NY 10001 ("SAGE"), or St. Jude's, 262 Danny Thomas Place, Memphis, TN 38105 or the charity of your choice. 1/3
